Tiap Bangun Pagi Buwas Mikirin Bunga Utang Bulog Rp 10 M/Hari!
01 Nov 2019, 11:05 by Vadhia Lidyana


Foto: Grandyos Zafna

Jakarta - Direktur Utama Perum Bulog Budi Waseso (Buwas) buka-bukaan soal kondisi perusahaan pelat merah tersebut. Bulog yang punya tugas melaksanakan pengadaan Cadangan Beras Pemerintah (CBP), harus mengeluarkan biaya besar baik dari pinjaman maupun kas perusahaan. CBP tersebut diadakan melalui serapan beras petani dalam negeri, maupun impor. Buwas mengungkapkan, untuk pengadaan tersebut butuh biaya triliunan."Kita dapat penugasan dari negara untuk impor beras contohnya, ini kan beras CBP, tapi yang mengimpor dan membeli Bulog, uangnya pinjam, utangnya Bulog. Ini masalah besar, karena nilainya triliunan dan bunganya komersial. Sedangkan CBP ini tidak bisa kita jual belikan kecuali ada penugasan," ungkap Buwas dalam acara Ngopi BUMN, di kantor Kementerian BUMN, Jakarta, Jumat (1/11/2019).Menambahkan hal tersebut, Asisten Deputi Usaha Industri Agro dan Farmasi Kementerian BUMN Agus Suharyono mengatakan, Bulog harus berhadapan dengan bunga pinjaman Rp 10 miliar setiap harinya."Setiap bangun pagi Pak Budi ini mikirin bunga. Bunga itu catatan kami hampir Rp 10 miliar, satu hari!" kata Agus.Belum lagi operasional perusahaan dan 4.000 karyawan setiap harinya yang bisa menelan biaya Rp 6 miliar/hari."Beliau (Buwas) juga harus menyiapkan 4.000 karyawan, yang setiap hari operasional butuh Rp 6 miliar," terang Agus.Menurut Agus, Bulog sebagai Badan Usaha Milik Negara (BUMN) juga punya tugas untuk mencetak laba. Sehingga, baik Bulog maupun pemerintah harus mengisi regulasi-regulasi yang diperlukan agar program komersial Bulog dapat berjalan."Masih ada ruang-ruang kosong regulasi yang harus diisi. Ini penting agar bulog tidak hanya menjalankan penugasan itu, karena ada satu peran yang sudah tercatat di peraturan BUMN yaitu mencetak laba," ujar Agus.Kini, Bulog tengah berupaya menambahkan pemasukan perusahaan mulai dari berinovasi dengan mengeluarkan produk-produk beras bervitamin, tepung berbahan dasar bekatul, hingga merambah pasar online. Every morning you wake up thinking about Bulog debt interest of IDR 10 billion / day!
01 Nov 2019, 11:05 by Vadhia Lidyana


Photo: Grandyos Zafna

Jakarta - Bulog President Director Budi Waseso (Buwas) is open about the condition of the state-owned company. Bulog, which has the task of carrying out the procurement of Government Rice Reserves (CBP), must incur large costs from both loans and company cash. The CBP was held through the absorption of domestic farmers' rice, as well as imports. Buwas revealed, for procurement it requires trillions of costs. "We can assign from the state to import rice, for example, this is CBP rice, but those who import and buy Bulog, borrow money, borrow from Bulog. This is a big problem, because the value is trillions and commercial interest. While CBP cannot be bought or sold unless there is an assignment, "said Buwas at the BUMN Coffee Cup, at the BUMN Ministry office, Jakarta, Friday (1/11/2019). Suharyono said, Bulog had to deal with loan interest of Rp 10 billion every day. "Every time you wake up in the morning, Mr. Budi thinks of interest. That interest is our record of nearly Rp 10 billion, one day!" Agus said. Not to mention the company's operations and 4,000 employees every day which could cost Rp. 6 billion / day. "He (Buwas) also has to prepare 4,000 employees, which every day requires Rp. 6 billion," said Agus. According to Agus, Bulog as a State-Owned Enterprise (BUMN) also has a duty to make profits. Thus, both Bulog and the government must fill in the regulations needed for the Bulog commercial program to work. "There are still spaces for regulations to be filled. This is important so that the Bulog does not only carry out the assignment, because there is one role that has been recorded in BUMN regulation is making a profit, "said Agus. Today, Bulog is trying to add company revenue, starting from innovating by issuing vitamin rice products, bran-based flour, to reaching the online market.
